Patent Information.Patent Title: Defensin Fragments For Use In Therapy Or Prophylaxis
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to new peptides derived from HD-5 or HNP-4 having antimicrobial activity for use in modulating the microbiome of intestines, the lungs, the skin, the mouth, the eye, the ear, the vagina or other bodily surfaces and/or for use as an antimicrobial agent in a human or other mammals, as well as to medicaments containing these peptides.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Human defensin-6 (HD-6; Defensin, alpha 6; Human, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.34206990]Virus:SARS-CoV-2:inhibition of infection in HEK293T-hACE2 cells(HD6 only blocked SARS-CoV-2 infection at the highest concentration tested (50 μg/mL, 13 μM)).Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ATCC 8739 (vLD50>256 µg/ml), E. coli ATCC 25922 (vLD50=103±14 µg/ml), Enterobacter aerogenes ATCC 13048 (vLD50=156±11 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (vLD50>256 µg/ml), S. aureus ATCC 29213 (vLD50>256 µg/ml), Bacillus cereus ATCC 10876 (vLD50=25±13 µg/ml).(Ref.3)NOTE:vLD50, virtual lethal doses (vLDs), equivalent to conventional 50% lethal doses (LD50s).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.34206990]No cytotoxicity on HEK293T cells up to 50 μg/mL.
Sequence Information.Function: Has very low antimicrobial activity against Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria. May protect cells against infection with HIV-1.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Paneth cells of the small intestine.
